The most striking argument is its highlight on the prestige factor. This person opines that the choosing job market of factories values the prestige factor more, and top-ranking universities like CalTech are regarded alongside Ivy authentics. Moreover, according to the argument, many good firms will give preference to CalTech with regards to hiring for their organizations than with G-Tech. Thus, if anything stands out in this comment, it might be preference for Option A 'California Institute of Technology' over Option B 'Georgia Institute of Technology.'
